intro: Hieracium stelligerum subsp. girerdii, commonly known as the mountain hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellowish to orange-yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. It has alternate, lanceolate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The subspecies girerdii is distinguished by its specific geographic distribution and slightly different morphological features compared to other subspecies of Hieracium stelligerum.
